reviews.title: Relaxation Above All Else?
Very relaxing holiday at the Holiday Inn Regent Cha-am
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for two weeks and were slightly apprehensive prior to arrival having read the reviews. We are used to four star and above accomodation, but due to moving house decided to save a great deal of money by staying in one of the budget rooms at the Holiday Inn Regent.

It was all I expected but my wife was very dissapointed as the balcony overlooked the large car park and there was a good deal of noise whilst trying to enjoy the sunset. Most of the noise came from the ATM situated in the small shopping mall!! Very loud signature tune which we became used to. We very much enjoyed the holiday once we became used to the hotel. It is in need of refurbishment and I was very surprised that one reviewer stated that the pool areas were very clean. The main pool needed a good clean and the water became quite murky by the end of the fortnight. We did paddle in the sea which wasn't too bad, as good as the vast majority of beaches in the U.K.
reviews.title: Regency is great if you have the right expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach was rather good and far better than expected. We didn't expect to be so far from CHA-AM or HUA HIN as a map we had seen on the internet had incorrect measurements. In fact we started a walk expecting to reach CHA-AM before realising it is some considerable distance especially in the extreme heat i.e. 35-38 degrees every day and not a drop of rain. A taxi to CHA-AM from just outside the hotel was 200 BAHT, and a taxi to HUA HIN 250 BAHT (250 BAHT approx 4 GBP). The experience of the rest of the hotel was very pleasant with lovely garden areas and flowers overhanging the walkways. One reviewer has mentioned the fishing lake which we walked and cycled around. We saw lots of birds here including a kingfisher and there is a compound with deer and their young near to the main entrance.
reviews.title: Chalets are the best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only ate once at what we thought was the hotel - quite confusing - we had a map from the internet of the REGENT CHA-AM, but we're not sure if Holiday Inn have taken over the whole estate. We went to a restaurant at the Regent Chalets which I think was called CHOM TALAY. This was very good with a beautiful view over the beach and sea and a spectacular moon. The food and service was faultless but compared to the prices we had become accustomed to was rather expensive. Still only £36.00 for a shared starter, two mains and a shared dessert with drinks. (My wife is an athlete and not a big eater) Go to the small "village!" just outside the hotel and a meal for two with drinks can be had from as little as £6.00 upwards. Fish main courses usually 250 BAHT. The problem with the Chom Talay was that we thought we would charge the meal to our room but we were told it was a seperate hotel. Hence the confusion. I had to go back to the Regent to fetch my credit card to pay for the meal as we hadn't taken enough cash. Ooops!!
reviews.title: Can't wait to return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Regent Beach Resort Cha-Am for 6 days as the 3rd and final part of our Thailand tour, it was late at night when we arrived after a 3 hour taxi drive from Bangkok, Check in went really smoothly and we were in our room in no time at all, Our room was on the ground floor and was comfortable, spacious, and spotlessly clean as is the whole hotel, had a tv, dvd player, kettle and mini bar, but no safety deposit box, so we had to use the Free ones that are located in reception. Our balcony led onto the gardens, which are very well kept, the hotel has 2 good size pools and a jacuzzi pool, the beach has soft white sand and is very clean. Along the beach in both directions, there are bar/restaurants and massage areas, there are a lot of traders on the beach but they don't hassle you if you say "no thanks". Outside in front of the hotel reception there are some shops but many were unoccupied. There's also a small village, turn left outside the hotel, about 200 yards, and has bars/restaurants and shops and tailors, we tried a few of the restaurants of which were all good, the best breakfast we found was at J&K English Restaraunt the owner John's English and his wife Kag is Thai, best of both worlds English and Thai food.
reviews.title: Comfortable Hotel, Quite Loccation

reviews.text: We used the hotel shuttle service to go into Cha-Am and Hua-Hin at night, you can book for that in reception. We did a few trips of our own from the Taxi rank that are near the village, wheres theres a notice board with a price list. We visited the Royal Palace , Phra Nakhon Khiri, in Phetchaburi, monkey mountain and caves, Elephant treking, Damnoen Saduak, Floating Market, and Khao San Roi Yot National Park, where from the beach and after a long tail boat ride around some Islands, we landed on another beach, we walked up a track through the small forest which led to another rocky path with a 450m steep uphill mountain trek, (it was really hard going), to see the Phra Nakhon cave, where there is the Subterranean sanctuary of King Rama V's pavilion, the Tham Phraya Nakhon cave chamber which contains a temple , breathtaking, absolutely amazingly beautiful,(see my photos) its well worth the 50 mins up hillwalk slog, we passed many people who gave up. This is a good hotel we would definatly go back.
reviews.title: Wonderful!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ROOMS - We only paid for a standard room but were given a room in the Regency wing, which was gorgeous. Quite a big room, with fridge, Satelitte TV, 2 queen size beds and a big balcony. The bathroom was really big too, with a good shower over the bath. The air-con was great and everything was so clean and new looking. Our room looked right over the beach and it was so relaxing.
reviews.title: Fantastic

likes.liked: — The rooms were spotless and nice and cool all of the time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: POOL - The pool at the main building was very big and there was a nice breeze from the sea. We spent most of the time at the regency pool as the kids loved the monkey fountains and there was a so a really nice kids pool for toddlers. We never had trouble getting a sunlounger no matter what time we got there. There were towels available and they were really big and fluffy! There was also a jacuzzi that looked like a small lagoon, very pretty. But beware there is a huge lizard that lives on the rocks there!!!!! It was even swimming in the pool one day!!!!!
reviews.title: A great stay

aka: Regent Chalet Regent Beach Cha-Am Hotel Cha-Am
description: The Regent Cha-Am Beach Resort has a view of majestic mountains, lush gardens and the panoramic Gulf. The hotel is in fact three hotels in one: The Regent Cha-Am, The Regency Wing, and The Regent Chalet. With its large area and its light and airy design, the hotel manages to attract diverse clientele yet remain a peaceful, tranquil retreat.
